solution_line_template: A month has {weeks_per_month} weeks, so there are {number_of_months}*{weeks_per_month}= <<{number_of_months}*{weeks_per_month}={total_weeks}>>{total_weeks} weeks in four months.

Since the tree grows for fifty centimeters every {growth_rate_interval_weeks} weeks, it will grow by fifty centimeters every week for {total_weeks}/{growth_rate_interval_weeks} = <<{total_weeks}/{growth_rate_interval_weeks}={number_of_growth_intervals}>>{number_of_growth_intervals} weeks.

The tree will increase in height by {number_of_growth_intervals}*{growth_per_period} = <<{number_of_growth_intervals}*{growth_per_period}={height_increase}>>{height_increase} centimeters after four months.

Since {meter_unit} meter equals {cm_per_meter} centimeters, the tree is currently {current_height_meters}*{cm_per_meter} = <<{current_height_meters}*{cm_per_meter}={current_height_cm}>>{current_height_cm} centimeters tall.

After growing by {height_increase} centimeters for four months, the tree will be {height_increase}+{current_height_cm} = <<{height_increase}+{current_height_cm}={final_height_cm}>>{final_height_cm} centimeters tall.
